message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a great opportunity to get your hands on something really valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $100. I'm willing to make a fair offer, but I'm trying to stay within my budget. Can you meet me at $100?

I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, Bob. I appreciate your honesty. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $100. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer you the product for $110. It's a fair compromise, considering the product's value to you.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above that price. I'm willing to pay $105 for the product. Can you consider that?
I understand you're still a bit above your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer you the product for $108. It's the best I can do, considering the product's value to you.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but I'm still a bit above $108. I'm willing to meet you in the middle and pay $107 for the product. Can you consider that?

I'm not willing to go any lower, Bob. I've already compromised a lot, and I'm not willing to give up any more. I'll give you one more chance to meet me at $109. If you're not willing to do that, I'll have to consider selling the product to someone else.

I understand you've made some concessions, Alice, and I appreciate that. However, I'm still a bit tight on my budget. I'm willing to pay $106 for the product. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I'm sorry, Bob, but I've already compromised a lot and I'm not willing to go any lower. I think we've reached the end of the negotiation. I'm going to sell the product to John for $80, as I originally planned.
